attributes.action: We want to increase the National Minimum Wage
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom has a statistically world economy in the top 5,but the lives of most people who live here are not very good.In statistics,the economy is ok,but the vast majority are struggling for a better living
attributes.background: Year-September 2019:25 and over-£9.50,21 to 24-£9.00,18 to 20-£7.50,Under18-£6.50,Apprentice-£5.90.The pound is falling and the inflation too high.This increases the quality of life and the hope of life,can once again class this nation among the best countries to live

rejection.details:
We understand that you're concerned about the minimum wage, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. In particular, we're not sure if you want the rates to rise in September 2019.

National Minimum Wage rates are reviewed each year by the Government, advised by the Low Pay Commission. Rates were last increased in April 2019. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There are already petitions about the minimum wage. You might like to sign these if they call for something you'd like to happen. You're more likely to get action on an issue if you sign and share a single petition.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241386

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/240970
